com.spazedog.lib.rootfw3.extenders

Class FilesystemExtender.Filesystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.spazedog.lib.rootfw3.extenders.FilesystemExtender.Filesystem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ExtenderGroup
    Enclosing class:
    FilesystemExtender

    public static class FilesystemExtender.Filesystem
extends java.lang.Object
implements ExtenderGroup
    This class is used to collect different file system related information. This information are things like defined file systems, currently mounted file systems etc.
    Note that this implements the ExtenderGroup interface, which means that it does not allow anything outside RootFW to create an instance of it. Use RootFW.filesystem() to retrieve an instance.

      • getMountList

        public FilesystemExtender.MountStat[] getMountList()
        This will return a list of all currently mounted file systems, with information like device path, mount location, file system type and mount options.
        Returns:
        An array of FilesystemExtender.MountStat objects

      • getFstabList

        public FilesystemExtender.MountStat[] getFstabList()
        This will provide the same information as FilesystemExtender#getMountList() only this will not provide information about currently mounted file systems. Instead, it will return a list of all the file systems defined in every fstab and init.rc file in the ramdisk.
        It can be useful in situations where a file system might have been moved by a script, and you need the original defined location. Or perhaps you need the original device of a specific mount location.
        Returns:
        An array of FilesystemExtender.MountStat objects

      • hasTypeSupport

        public java.lang.Boolean hasTypeSupport(java.lang.String fstype)
        Check whether a file system type is supported by the kernel.
